actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act and chapter 21 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to increase the minimum amount of cash remuneration which an individual performing domestic service in the private home of an employer must receive from such employer in any quarter in order to have such remuneration counted as covered wages for either benefit or tax purposes.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act and the Internal Revenue Code to require that a domestic worker in a private home, in order to be covered under OASDI, must receive (instead of at least $50 per quarter) at least the minimum amount necessary for an individual to be credited with a quarter of coverage.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act and chapter 21 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to increase the minimum amount of cash remuneration which an individual performing domestic service in the private home of an employer must receive from such employer in any quarter in order to have such remuneration counted as covered wages for either benefit or tax purposes.
